title: Microsoft Fixes 114 Windows Flaws in January 2026 Patch, One Actively Exploited
summary: In January 2026, Microsoft released a significant security update addressing 114 vulnerabilities in its Windows operating system, including a critical flaw that was actively being exploited by cyber attackers. The patch aims to mitigate risks associated with these vulnerabilities, enhancing the overall security framework of Windows. This update underscores Microsoft's ongoing commitment to safeguarding its user base against potential threats and ensuring the integrity and reliability of its software products. Users are encouraged to promptly apply the update to protect their systems from potential exploits and improve their security posture.

title: Go jump in a lake: Measuring the data lake effect on your SIEM
summary: The article explores the integration of data lakes with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) systems, highlighting the transformative impact on cybersecurity operations.
